titleStmt.title: Doctor Hammond his Ektenesteron, or a greater ardency in Christ's love of God at one time, than another proved to be utterly irreconcileable with 1. His fulnesse of habituall grace. 2. The perpetuall happinesse, and 3. The impeccability of his soule. By Henry Ieanes, minister of Gods Word at Chedzoy in Somerset-shire
titleStmt.author: Jeanes, Henry, 1611-1662.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Henry Hall, printer to the University, for Thomas Robinson,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Hammond, Henry. Ektenesteron.
Fourth word of title in Greek characters.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
